Festivals: ['Filmfest Hamburg', 'Reykjavik International Film Festival', 'Busan International Film Festival', 'Filmfest Hamburg', 'Reykjavik International Film Festival', 'FemArt', 'FIFF Namur', 'Oslo/Fusion International Film Festival', 'Arte Mare - Mediterranean Film Festival', 'Moscow Jewish Film Festival', 'Terra Di Tutti Film Festival', 'Chagrin Documentary Film Festival', 'New Holland Island International Debut Film Festival', 'Olhar de Cinema - Curitiba International Film Festival', 'Busan International Film Festival', 'Festival du Nouveau Cinéma de Montréal', 'Hamptons International Film Festival', 'Yamagata International Documentary Film Festival', 'Bend Film Festival', 'Heartland International Film Festival', 'Sitges - International Fantastic Film Festival of Catalunya']
Narrative: In the history of Afghanistan, the Hazara people have suffered various collective sufferings in different periods. According to history and the testimony of undeniable documents, massacres, ethnic cleansing, enslavement of women and children, forced migration from ancestral lands, usurpation of land and property, systematic racial discrimination, social exclusion, systematic exclusion from economic and political relations and other types of sufferings and hardships. Jami is a summary of the hardships that this ethnic group has experienced in the history of Afghanistan. Therefore, the systematic military, political and social pressure on millennials and the rejection of this ethnic group is not only a new phenomenon that has been applied to this ethnic group with more intensity than in the current era.
Title: Why is the genocide of the Hazara people denied?
